projects.title: Dual Rasterizer
projects.description: Project in which I learnt different rendering techniques, I made both a software rasterizer and a ray tracer. Then I also made a hardware version of the same ray tracer using openly. I spent quite some time looking for optimizations all throughout my code to get as many frames per second as I could.

projects.title: Shrimpact
projects.description: Team project in which I learnt how to work in a team. We made a full game from prototyping to polish. I mostly worked on the ui and camera system but helped out on various parts of the project where needed. A big part of this project involved planning what everyone would be working every week.

projects.title: Zombie Game AI
projects.description: Project which I made a state based ai to play a small survival game and score as high as possible. I used utility scoring to have it decide between which action currently is the best action to take.

projects.title: Custom Game Engine
projects.description: Project in which I learnt how to use programming patterns for clean system design. I made my own component based game engine, I spent a lot of time thinking about how my interfaces would be used and what features would be nice to have even if not required to function.

projects.title: Lua Engine Bindings
projects.description: Project in which I made an existing game engine addressable through Lua. I used sol2 to create bindings between engine functions and Lua, then I wrote solitaire with all game logic happening in Lua.

projects.title: Blasphemous Recreation
projects.description: Early project in which I recreated a 2D game. Remaking the Metroidvania Blasphemous, I learnt a lot on how to use files to store data like levels or animation frames in an unordered spritesheet. I used jsoncpp for this with a small secondary program I made to be able to easily edit these files.
